file_content.text: There are many more artifacts here. I will guide the Voss as best I can.
Tolec-Da. I think I have something you're looking for.
The Mirr. You survived. We are grateful.
Tread carefully, Tolec-Da. The Mirr is a dark artifact. It could corrupt the Mystics.
The Jedi understand this darkness, even if the rest of the Republic does not.
Knight Wen doesn't speak for the order, Tolec-Da.
I trust the Voss.
The Jedi do not understand. They will learn.
We're certainly trying.
If there are more artifacts, the Voss could use your skills.
Then help them.
The Jedi have some sight. Stay. Help.
If you truly value my opinion, I will do what I can.
The Mystics will do what's best for Voss.
Have some faith.
If the Mirr does not decide that for them.
The Mystics see. The Mirr is a tool.
You act like we started the second Sith War.
You worry too much.
For the galaxy's sake, I hope we haven't.
If the Mystics see it. We do what we must.
What are your plans for the Mirr, Tolec-Da?
What happens now?
Don't like it, don't ask.
The future would be far more certain if I had.
You failed. The outsiders succeeded.
You failed. The outsider did better.
The Mirr will go to Voss-Ka. I will tell the Mystics of this. You will be honored.
If that is the price of our safety, I hope the Republic makes the most of it.
You return. Where is the Mirr?
I turned that ruin upside down. The Mirr's gone.
[Lie] I couldn't find it.
Impossible. Look again.
We have searched long enough, Tolec-Da. Clearly, the Mirr is not meant to be found.
The Mirr was too dangerous. I got rid of it.
We had to destroy it.
The Mirr is destroyed? How? Why?
I am sorry, but we could not allow the Mystics to possess such a powerful artifact.
I just followed Knight Wen's instructions.
Ask Knight Wen.
The Mirr should have been there. Something must have happened.
The Jedi believe the Force gives us signs. Perhaps this is a sign to end our search.
The Mirr held too many dark temptations. I'm sure our friends agree.
The Mirr held too many dark temptations. Don't you agree, my friend?
The Mirr would have brought you nothing but trouble.
This is for the best.
Outsiders cannot understand.
Few Jedi could resist the Mirr's dark power.
It was a danger to us all.
The Mystics are not Jedi.
I did what I could to keep the Voss safe.
Just trying to help.
We do not need your protection.
Looked like a harmless trinket to me.
If you say so.
The Mirr was Voss. Legend.
Now I'm not so sure.
Be silent. You have lost the Mirr.
Don't look at me.
The Three will hear of this. Outsiders cannot be trusted.
I realize this was difficult. On behalf of the order, I thank you for your assistance.
The Mirr is in the ruins. You know what to do.
The Mirr must be found. Try again.
The Mirr's power is not worth the price, Tolec-Da. I barely survived the last attempt--
More outsiders. You will need help. Ask.
Another Jedi. Two may succeed. Ask.
A Republic commando will survive. Ask.
An outsider. This one has not tried. Ask.
Greetings. I am Knight Wen. I have been assisting the Voss in their search for a powerful artifact known as the Mirr.
But navigating these ruins, retrieving the Mirr, getting ambushed by the Sith... perhaps you may have better luck.
For a fellow Jedi, I'll do my very best.
Glad to help a friend.
For the Voss, you would not?
The Jedi should learn all they can about the Voss.
You've got me interested.
Learn later. Find the Mirr now.
The Republic's always happy to help her allies.
Anything for the Voss.
The Jedi are not.
We are not allies yet.
You've got the Force. I'm just quick on the draw.
I'm no Jedi, but I'll try.
Knight Wen has failed many times.
What is the Mirr? What does it do?
The Mirr?
The Mirr is for the Mystics. Only they can see.
Depends what's involved.
Your Basic is not quite up to par, Tolec-Da. You should investigate our findings so far. Allow me to explain.
Find the Mirr. We will be grateful.
The Mirr is part of Voss legend. They believe it will help the Mystics have clearer visions. But it is no Voss relic.
I found the Mirr inside a Sith altar. I can sense its dark presence from here. We cannot let the Mystics be exposed to it.
The Mystics could destroy us with their visions alone.
The Voss are dangerous enough.
All they lack is the motivation. The Empire is ready and willing to provide that.
The Mystics know so little of the Force, light or dark.
The Voss need our guidance.
It is the order's responsibility to guide them, for their safety, and ours.
If we tell Tolec-Da, he can call off the search.
We should warn them.
I have. "Outsider nonsense." The Voss have no concept of the Force or its dangers.
Pretend I'm not a Jedi. Could you translate that?
In Basic, please.
The dark side offers quick, brutal solutions--the path of a Sith. A Jedi is trained to resist.
How does a Sith artifact end up buried on Voss?
Why is the Mirr here?
The ruins bear Sith markings. The Sith visited Voss long before our current troubles.
The Mystics aren't children. They can use the Force.
Their call, not ours.
The Mystics are not Jedi or Sith. Their power is raw, unchecked. The Mirr would offer too many temptations.
It would be better if the Mirr was never found. You and I can make sure of that--by destroying it.
Using my lightsaber would be too suspicious.
How do I do that?
I would rather have Tolec-Da's permission.
If it's the only way.
We have no choice. Even if Tolec-Da understood, he would never agree.
The Republic needs an alliance with the Voss.
Only if we keep it quiet.
Are you certain? The dangers of an alliance should be plain to you now.
Artifacts, darkness, whatever. I just want creds.
If it's worth my while.
The order isn't known for a generous paycheck, but I'll give what I can.
And if I brought the Mirr back here instead?
Maybe I disagree.
I have no desire to offend or anger the Voss. This is for their protection.
You'll find the Mirr where I left it--inside the Sith altar. Do not linger, or you may attract their attention.
There is a chasm nearby. You can dispose of the Mirr there.
When I return, it'll be like the Mirr never existed.
I'll destroy the Mirr.
If only Tolec-Da and the others could be so easily convinced.
We have no right to keep the Mirr from the Voss.
The Mirr must go to the Voss.
Then you must be prepared to face the consequences.
The Mirr cannot be lost. Do the outsiders agree?
The Mirr remains hidden. Will the outsider help?
Rest easy, Tolec-Da. We have an understanding.
The Mirr will be returned to you. No matter the risk.
There are many Sith within the ruins. Be cautious.
Not interested. [Refuse quest]
Please, reconsider. It's only a matter of time before the Voss find the Mirr.
I sense much darkness in these ruins. Be wary.
Risking the fall of the Voss for what? Progress between politicians?
